Come ride with us! Below is some useful information to help you find your bus route and schedule.

For help finding the right route, use the Plan Your Trip tool on GoRaleigh.org. New to riding the bus? The GoRaleigh Ride Guide provides information on how to ride the bus.

Holidays:

There are certain holidays when GoRaleigh doesn't operate or runs reduced service* so staff members can spend time with family and friends. Please check your route's schedule to see what trips may be affected.

New Yearâ€™s Day: Sunday level service, last departures during the 10 p.m. hour

MLK: Sunday level service, last departures during the 10 p.m. hour

Memorial Day: Sunday level service, last departures during the 10 p.m. hour

July 4: Sunday level service, last departures during the 10 p.m. hour

Labor Day: Sunday level service, last departures during the 10 p.m. hour

Thanksgiving: No service

Christmas Eve: Last departures during the 7 p.m. hour.

Christmas Day: No service

*Reduced Service means GoRaleigh routes will use the Sunday schedule. Bus routes that only have weekday hours will not be in service.

R-Line and Commuter Express Routes

R-Line Downtown Circulator

The R-Line is Downtown Raleigh's bus route. It connects employees, residents and visitors to retail, restaurants, entertainment venues and parking in the Central Business District.

The R-Line runs approximately every 15 minutes and is served by 2 buses.

Reasonable Modification / Accommodation Policy

The Federal Department of Transportation has recently revised the rules for the Americans with Disabilities Act and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973. The revised rules provide for public transit organizations to make reasonable modifications and accommodations to policies, practices and procedures to avoid discrimination and to ensure accessibility to individuals with disabilities. Individuals with disabilities may request that GoRaleigh make reasonable accommodations in order to fully use transit services. All requests should be made by submitting a Reasonable Accommodation Request verbally or in writing.

To obtain a form or to file a request verbally please call 919-996-4087. Mailed requests should go to:

City of Raleigh

Attn: Transit Program

PO Box 590

Raleigh, NC 27602
